p: Concentrations of outbreak isolates and COAV997-5nt were measured in homogenates of five individual fully engorged females collected immediately following blood meal exposure of each group of Cx. tarsalis ( Table 2). The number of WNV RNA copies present in each blood meal was expressed as the ratio of the outbreak isolate to COAV997-5nt ( Table 2), and this was utilized for normalizing competition data [ 24]. Bodies and expectorants from surviving Cx. tarsalis were collected on 14 dpi and infection rates ( Table 2) determined based on the percentage of bodies containing WNV RNA (outbreak isolate and/or COAV997-5nt).
